definition: chicken stock/chicken soup/(fig.) chicken soup for the soul – i.e. feel-good motivational stories (often used disparagingly because the stories don't really effect change in people's lives)
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
samgyetang, popular Korean chicken soup with ginseng, spices etc
(coll.) profit-motivated article cynically disguised as feel-good content 雞湯|鸡汤[ji1 tang1] and designed to go viral

sentences.english: As it turns out, a handful of scientific studies show that chicken soup really could have medicinal value.
sentences.chinese: 而且幾項科學研究也表明，雞湯的確具有藥用價值。

sentences.english: Chicken soup is often thought to be a healthy dish (prepared by a family member) and (given to us) when we are sick.
sentences.chinese: 雞湯常被認爲是我們生病時，家人爲我們準備的補品。

sentences.english: We have"Wangji Chicken Soup" and "Steamed Wuchang Fish".
sentences.chinese: 有汪集雞湯和清蒸武昌魚。

sentences.english: Yeah, I've got a pretty good case of the blahs. I don't feel like doing much of anything.
sentences.chinese: 我給你熬了點兒雞湯，或許你喝了會感覺好一些。

sentences.english: The chicken carcass can be rendered down to make stock.
sentences.chinese: 雞的骨架可以熬成雞湯。

sentences.english: Add chicken stock and bring to a simmer.
sentences.chinese: 然後加入午餐肉和雞湯慢燉。

sentences.english: Add egg whites to broth and heat. Then pour the mixture on top of the melon. Serve.
sentences.chinese: 將蛋白加入雞湯煮成汁，淋在節瓜甫上即成。

sentences.english: Slowly add the chicken stock, wine and stir continously until boiling.
sentences.chinese: 加入雞湯，白酒，慢火煮到開。

sentences.english: Add chicken broth and seasoning, simmer for 20minutes.
sentences.chinese: 加入清雞湯及調味料後煮20分鐘。

sentences.english: Stir in tomatoes, tomato puree and chicken broth.
sentences.chinese: 鍋中加入西紅柿塊和西紅柿醬及雞湯，大火燒開。

sentences.english: Prep the pantry with liquids, tea and chicken soup.
sentences.chinese: 同時準備一些流質食物，便當和雞湯。

sentences.english: The flavor of chicken soup on the slow fire with deliciousness and the milky taste.
sentences.chinese: 老火煲雞風味，突出了雞湯的鮮甜感和脂肪香氣。

sentences.english: You can look at her and say, "We don't have any of the ingredients for chicken soup."
sentences.chinese: 你可以看着她，說“我們都沒有做雞湯的食材。”

sentences.english: She ladled  chicken soup from  the boiler.
Small Boy eats rice with soup and fights for the steam chicken with Small Girl.
sentences.chinese: 粗眉仔用雞湯撈飯，仲同表妹搶蒸雞食。

sentences.english: I give you the chicken soup, Bubu body.
sentences.chinese: 我給你燉了雞湯，補補身子。

definition: soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
to work extra hours/to do overtime
to concentrate (a liquid)/concentration/espresso coffee/abbr. for 意式濃縮咖啡|意式浓缩咖啡
